protein.specific_function: In muscle, parvalbumin is thought to be involved in relaxation after contraction. It binds two calcium ions

reference.reference_text: Berchtold MW: Parvalbumin genes from human and rat are identical in intron/exon organization and contain highly homologous regulatory elements and coding sequences. J Mol Biol. 1989 Dec 5;210(3):417-27.
